text:
Cute quiet area, nice to do work, have plugs
But staff looked tired / no smiles
Choco oreo & tiramisu bing su ($14.4)
Best for 3-4 pax, portion big
Didnt use original oreo, the cubes of tiramisu cake not nice
Chocolate ice cream okay
shaved ice part nice üëç

It's a perfect place to occupy your little one with arts and krafts. The conductors are super nice and little ones love them.
I have seen there are more krafty projects available for older kids. That must be fun too. When my girl gets older I will bring her for those as well.
The atmosphere is great, the service is good, the food is good, and it's very convenient for people who want to eat quietly, study, or just relax with a cup of juice.ü§ç

Honestly, the best bingsu that I have ever had! The ice was shaved so incredibly fine and the portion was humongous! The ice cream on top was very rich and creamy. The mango was very ripe and fresh and the portions were very generous! It took four of us to finish the one bowl! A very well-kept local secret in the basement of this modest looking Mall.

Had the Injeolmi Bingsu. Average tasting. Bought Bingsu because craving for it. Really friendly staff and quaint place to chill at. Next to a studio rental and also there are taekwondo classes just next to it. Good for parents waiting for their kids. They also have some seats for work. There's charging stations and also free WiFi.
